In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia with a text width limit of 10 characters:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    words = split_words(text)
    wrapped_text = ""

    for word in words
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            wrapped_text += word
        else
            wrapped_text *= " " # Add a space before the word
            wrapped_text += word
        end
    end

    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a test string with several words. Let's see if wrap_string can handle it correctly."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the `wrap_string` function is called with a test text. The output will be the wrapped text, where each word is added on a new line when the maximum text width is exceeded.
